questions.question: What is the time period to submit an objection for company registration changes?
questions.expected:
Thirty days from the date of publication in the official gazette [1].

References
1. Kuwait Official Gazette 2025-04-27, Lines 5228-5327.
questions.answer:
- Generally: 30 days from the date of publication to submit an objection to the Court of First Instance (for legal‑entity amendments, dissolutions/liquidations, etc.).
- Exception: Some notices (e.g., transfer of commercial licenses or converting an individual license) specify 15 days to object at the relevant Ministry department.

questions.question: Where should objections to company registration be submitted?
questions.expected:
Objections should be submitted to the General Court (المحكمة الكلية) [1].

References
1. Kuwait Official Gazette 2025-04-27, Lines 5228-5327.
questions.answer: To the Court of First Instance (General Court (المحكمة الكلية)), within 30 days of the announcement’s publication.

questions.question: What types of legal entities are mentioned in company registration announcements?
questions.expected:
Limited Liability Company, One-Person Company (شركة الشخص الواحد), Joint Stock Company, and Partnership [1][2].

References
1. Kuwait Official Gazette 2025-04-27, Lines 1799-1899.
2. Kuwait Official Gazette 2025-04-27, Lines 5228-5327.
questions.answer:
- Limited Liability Company (LLC) — شركة ذات مسؤولية محدودة (also shown as W.L.L. in some entries)
- One-Person Company (SPC) — شركة الشخص الواحد
- General Partnership Company — شركة تضامنية
- Simple Limited Partnership — شركة توصية بسيطة
- Closed Joint Stock Company — شركة مساهمة مقفلة (abbreviated K.S.C.C. or K.S.C. (Closed))
- Public Shareholding Company — شركة مساهمة عامة (abbreviated K.S.C.P.)

questions.question: What happens to joint partner obligations when an objection is filed for company registration?
questions.expected:
The submission of an objection results in the continued obligation of joint partners in the case of a general partnership or a simple limited partnership until the objection is resolved by the court [1].

References
1. Kuwait Official Gazette 2025-04-27, Lines 5228-5327.
questions.answer: Filing an objection keeps the joint partners’ obligations in force—specifically in a general partnership or a simple limited partnership—toward the creditor until the court issues a ruling on the objection.

questions.question: When an individual commercial license is converted into a general partnership, what form must an objection take and what happens if it is not submitted during the announcement period?
questions.expected:
It must be a written objection submitted during the announcement period; otherwise, the objection will not be taken into consideration. [1]

References
1. Kuwait Official Gazette 2025-05-11, Lines 15786–15790.
questions.answer:
- Form: A written objection submitted to the Companies Department, accompanied by a debt instrument (proof of debt).
- If late/not submitted within the announcement period: Any objection filed after the 15 days from publication will not be considered.
